definition: evening newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Evening News
Lawcourt evening news, offshoot of 北京年青报 specialising in legal news, www.fawan.com

sentences.english: I asked her to fetch me an evening paper.
sentences.chinese: 我求她去給我拿一張晚報來。

sentences.english: One of the latest such reports was published by the Beijing-based Legal Mirror on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 而最新的一篇相關報道發表在週六的《法制晚報》上。

sentences.english: I have renewed my subscription to the evening paper.

sentences.chinese: 這其中《齊魯晚報》的社區新聞是其中的代表。

sentences.english: I sometimes read Yangcheng Evening Paper.

sentences.chinese: 第四章介紹了《齊魯晚報》社區新聞的版面策劃。

sentences.english: She reviews the new movie once a week in one of the evening papers.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家晚報上每週評論一次新影片。

sentences.english: Finally, the analysis "Qilu Evening News" community news of a news event planning.
sentences.chinese: 最後，分析《齊魯晚報》社區新聞的新聞事件策劃。

sentences.english: The distribution of Changsha Evening News has exerted great impacts.
sentences.chinese: 《長沙晚報》的發行所帶來的影響是巨大的。

sentences.english: The app keeps track of how many people have checked-in at a location each night.
sentences.chinese: 該程序會記錄下某一地點每晚報到的人數。

sentences.english: Advertisements often fill in two pages of the evening paper.
sentences.chinese: 廣告常佔滿這家晚報的兩頁。

sentences.english: A man surnamed Zhang in Benxi, Liaoning Province, was arrested and charged with extortion, Liaoshen Evening News reports.
sentences.chinese: 據《遼瀋晚報》報道，遼寧本溪一村民因敲詐被捕。

sentences.english: Chongqing Evening News reporter shook his mention plastic glue pot, which has a little liquid.
sentences.chinese: 重慶晚報記者提起塑料膠壺搖了搖，裏面有少許液體。

sentences.english: Changes my destiny is the Yangzi evening newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 改變沉香姐姐命運的是揚子晚報。

sentences.english: Marian peered at him over the top of the evening paper; her eyes were shifty with guilt.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗安越過晚報的上方凝視着他，眼神裏閃現着內疚。
